<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:12pt;">&#160;</p></ix:nonNumeric>
<p style="margin-top:6pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">New Senior Credit Facilities</p>
<p style="margin-top:6pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">On September 24, 2019, in connection with the Finisar acquisition, the Company entered the New Senior Credit Facilities with Bank of America, N.A., as Administrative Agent, Swing Line Lender and an L/C Issuer, and the other lenders party thereto. </p>
<p style="margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The New Credit Agreement provides for senior secured financing of $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000674" name="us-gaap:LineOfCreditFacilityMaximumBorrowingCapacity" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapCreditFacilityAxis_iiviSeniorSecuredCreditFacilityMember_us-gaapLineOfCreditFacilityAxis_iiviBankOfAmericaNAMember_20190924" decimals="INF" scale="9">2.425</ix:nonFraction>&#160;billion in the aggregate, consisting of </p>
<div style="align:left;">
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse; width:100%;">
<tr>
<td valign="top" style="width:6.67%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p></td>
<td valign="top" style="width:6.67%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">(i)</span></p></td>
<td valign="top">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;">Aggregate principal amount of $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000675" name="us-gaap:LineOfCreditFacilityMaximumBorrowingCapacity" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapCreditFacilityAxis_iiviTermALoanFacilityMember_us-gaapLineOfCreditFacilityAxis_iiviBankOfAmericaNAMember_20190924" decimals="INF" scale="9">1.255</ix:nonFraction>&#160;billion for a <span style="-sec-ix-hidden:F_000676">five-year</span> senior secured first-lien term A loan facility (the &#8220;Term A Facility&#8221;), </p></td></tr></table></div>
<div style="align:left;">
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse; width:100%;">
<tr>
<td valign="top" style="width:6.67%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;">&#160;</p></td>
<td valign="top" style="width:6.67%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">(ii)</span></p></td>
<td valign="top">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-size:10pt;">Aggregate principal amount of $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000677" name="us-gaap:LineOfCreditFacilityMaximumBorrowingCapacity" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapCreditFacilityAxis_iiviTermBLoanFacilityMember_us-gaapLineOfCreditFacilityAxis_iiviBankOfAmericaNAMember_20190924" decimals="INF" scale="9">720</ix:nonFraction>&#160;million for a <span style="-sec-ix-hidden:F_000678">seven-year</span> senior secured term B loan facility (the &#8220;Term B Facility&#8221; and together with the Term A Facility, the &#8220;Term Loan Facilities&#8221;) and </span></p></td></tr></table></div>
<div style="align:left;">
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse; width:100%;">
<tr>
<td valign="top" style="width:6.67%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;">&#160;</p></td>
<td valign="top" style="width:6.67%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><span style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">(iii)</span></p></td>
<td valign="top">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-size:10pt;">Aggregate principal amount of $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000679" name="us-gaap:LineOfCreditFacilityMaximumBorrowingCapacity" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapCreditFacilityAxis_us-gaapRevolvingCreditFacilityMember_us-gaapLineOfCreditFacilityAxis_iiviBankOfAmericaNAMember_20190924" decimals="INF" scale="9">450</ix:nonFraction>&#160;million for a <span style="-sec-ix-hidden:F_000680">five-year</span> senior secured first-lien revolving credit facility (the &#8220;Revolving Credit Facility&#8221; and together with the Term Loan Facilities, the &#8220;New Senior Credit Facilities&#8221;). </span></p></td></tr></table></div>
<p style="margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The New Credit Agreement also provides for a letter of credit sub-facility not to exceed $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000681" name="iivi:LetterOfCreditSubFacilityMaximumBorrowingCapacity" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapLineOfCreditFacilityAxis_iiviBankOfAmericaNAMember_20190924" decimals="INF" scale="6">25.0</ix:nonFraction>&#160;million and a swing loan sub-facility initially not to exceed $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000682" name="iivi:SwingLoanSubFacilityMaximumInitialBorrowingCapacity" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapLineOfCreditFacilityAxis_iiviBankOfAmericaNAMember_20190924" decimals="INF" scale="6">20.0</ix:nonFraction>&#160;million.</p>
<p style="margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The Company is obligated to repay the outstanding principal amount of the Term A Facility in quarterly installments equal to <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000683" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentRedemptionPricePercentageOfPrincipalAmountRedeemed" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapCreditFacilityAxis_iiviTermALoanFacilityMember_us-gaapLineOfCreditFacilityAxis_iiviBankOfAmericaNAMember_20190924_20190924" decimals="4" scale="-2">1.25</ix:nonFraction>% of the initial aggregate principal amount of the Term A Facility, with the remaining outstanding balance due and payable on the fifth anniversary of the Closing Date. Similarly, the Company is obligated to repay the outstanding principal amount of the Term B Facility in quarterly installments equal to <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000684" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentRedemptionPricePercentageOfPrincipalAmountRedeemed" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapCreditFacilityAxis_iiviTermBLoanFacilityMember_us-gaapLineOfCreditFacilityAxis_iiviBankOfAmericaNAMember_20190924_20190924" decimals="4" scale="-2">0.25</ix:nonFraction>% of the initial aggregate principal amount of the Term B Facility, with the remaining outstanding balance due and payable on the seventh anniversary of the Closing Date. The Company is obligated to repay the aggregate principal amount of all outstanding revolving loans made under the Revolving Credit Facility on the fifth anniversary of the Closing Date.</p>
<p style="margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The Company&#8217;s obligations under the New Senior Credit Facilities are guaranteed by each of the Company&#8217;s existing or future direct and indirect domestic subsidiaries, including Finisar and its domestic subsidiaries (collectively, the &#8220;Guarantors&#8221;). Borrowings under the New Senior Credit Facilities are collateralized by a first priority lien in substantially all of the assets of the Company and the Guarantors, except that no real property is collateral under the New Senior Credit Facilities.</p>
<p style="margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">All amounts outstanding under the New Senior Credit Facilities will become due and payable <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_utrD" id="F_000685" name="iivi:NumberOfDaysPriorToMaturityOfOutstanding" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapCreditFacilityAxis_iiviNewSeniorCreditFacilitiesMember_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_iiviZeroPointTwoFivePercentConvertibleSeniorNotesDueTwoThousandTwentyTwoMember_us-gaapTypeOfArrangementAxis_iiviIIVINotesMember_20190924_20190924" decimals="INF">120</ix:nonFraction> days prior to the maturity of the Company&#8217;s currently outstanding <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000686" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentInterestRateStatedPercentage" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapCreditFacilityAxis_iiviNewSeniorCreditFacilitiesMember_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_iiviZeroPointTwoFivePercentConvertibleSeniorNotesDueTwoThousandTwentyTwoMember_us-gaapTypeOfArrangementAxis_iiviIIVINotesMember_20190924" decimals="INF" scale="-2">0.25</ix:nonFraction>% Convertible Senior Notes due <ix:nonNumeric id="F_000687" name="iivi:DebtInstrumentMaturityYear" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapCreditFacilityAxis_iiviNewSeniorCreditFacilitiesMember_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_iiviZeroPointTwoFivePercentConvertibleSeniorNotesDueTwoThousandTwentyTwoMember_us-gaapTypeOfArrangementAxis_iiviIIVINotesMember_20190924_20190924">2022</ix:nonNumeric> (the &#8220;II-VI Notes&#8221;) if (i)&#160;the II-VI Notes remain outstanding, and (ii)&#160;the Company has insufficient cash and borrowing availability to repay the principal amount of the II-VI Notes. </p></ix:nonNumeric>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">17</p>
<hr style="page-break-after:always" />
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p><ix:continuation id="F_000384_dcnt_57580c76-c1b8-4388-b297-45f32a7c82cb" continuedAt="F_000384_dcnt_31df68d0-7086-4776-858c-fc4950412355">
<p style="margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The Company voluntarily may prepay, at any time or from time to time, any amounts outstanding under the New Senior Credit Facilities in </span><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">whole or in part without premium or penalty</span><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#59; except for the Term B Facility, </span><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">pursuant to</span><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"> which</span><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"> in the event of</span><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"> (a) a repayment made before September 24, 2020, (b) the occurrence of a repricing event, or (c) a change to the lenders, the Company will be subject to a prepayment premium in an amount equal to one percent of: (i) the principal amount of the Term B Facility that is prepaid under an optional or mandatory prepayment due to a repricing event, (ii) the aggregate outstanding principal amount of the Term B Facility resulting from an amendment to the New Credit Agreement, and (iii) the principal amount of the Term B Facility that is mandatorily assigned</span><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">. </span><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The Company may be subject to mandatory prepayment of amounts outstanding under the New Senior Credit Facilities under certain circumstances, including in connection with certain asset sales or</span><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"> </span><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">other dispositions of property and debt issuances. </span></p>
<p style="margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The Company also may be required to prepay amounts under the Term B Facility based on the Company&#8217;s excess cash flow (as calculated in accordance with the terms of the New Credit Agreement) for the Company&#8217;s prior fiscal year beginning with its fiscal year ending June&#160;30, 2020 and the Company&#8217;s consolidated secured net leverage ratio (as calculated in accordance with the terms of the New Credit Agreement) as of the end of such fiscal year.</p>
<p style="margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Amounts outstanding under the New Senior Credit Facilities will bear interest at a rate per annum equal to an applicable margin over a eurocurrency rate or an applicable margin over a base rate determined by reference to the highest of (a) the federal funds rate plus <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000688" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentBasisSpreadOnVariableRate1" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapCreditFacilityAxis_iiviNewSeniorCreditFacilitiesMember_us-gaapVariableRateAxis_us-gaapFederalFundsEffectiveSwapRateMember_20190924_20190924" decimals="INF" scale="-2">0.50</ix:nonFraction>%, (b) Bank of America, N.A.&#8217;s prime rate and (c) a eurocurrency rate plus <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000689" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentBasisSpreadOnVariableRate1" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapCreditFacilityAxis_iiviNewSeniorCreditFacilitiesMember_us-gaapVariableRateAxis_us-gaapEurodollarMember_20190924_20190924" decimals="INF" scale="-2">1.00</ix:nonFraction>%, in each case as calculated in accordance with the terms of the New Credit Agreement. The applicable interest rate would increase under certain circumstances relating to events of default.&#160;&#160;The Company has entered into an interest rate swap contract to hedge its exposure to interest rate risk on its variable rate borrowings under the New Senior Credit Facilities.&#160;&#160;Refer to Note 15 for further information regarding this interest rate swap.</p>
<p style="margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The New Credit Agreement contains customary affirmative and negative covenants with respect to the New Senior Credit Facilities, including limitations with respect to liens, investments, indebtedness, dividends, mergers and acquisitions, dispositions of assets and transactions with affiliates. The Company will be obligated to maintain a consolidated interest coverage ratio (as calculated in accordance with the terms of the new Credit Agreement) as of the end of each fiscal quarter of not less than <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000690" name="iivi:InterestCoverageRatio" contextRef="C_0000820318_srtRangeAxis_srtMinimumMember_us-gaapCreditFacilityAxis_iiviNewSeniorCreditFacilitiesMember_20190924_20190924" decimals="INF">3.00</ix:nonFraction>:1.00. The Company will be obligated to maintain a consolidated total net leverage ratio (as calculated in accordance with the terms of the New Credit Agreement) of not greater than (i) <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000691" name="iivi:LeverageRatio" contextRef="C_0000820318_srtRangeAxis_srtMaximumMember_us-gaapCreditFacilityAxis_iiviNewSeniorCreditFacilitiesMember_us-gaapDebtInstrumentRedemptionPeriodAxis_iiviFirstFourFiscalQuartersAfterClosingDateMember_20190924_20190924" decimals="INF">5.00</ix:nonFraction> to 1.00 for the first four fiscal quarters after the Closing Date, commencing with the first full fiscal quarter after the Closing Date, (ii) <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000692" name="iivi:LeverageRatio" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapCreditFacilityAxis_iiviNewSeniorCreditFacilitiesMember_us-gaapDebtInstrumentRedemptionPeriodAxis_iiviFifthFiscalQuarterThroughEighthFiscalQuarterAfterClosingDateMember_20190924_20190924" decimals="INF">4.50</ix:nonFraction> to 1.00 for the fifth fiscal quarter through and including the eighth fiscal quarter after the Closing Date, and (iii) <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000693" name="iivi:LeverageRatio" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapCreditFacilityAxis_iiviNewSeniorCreditFacilitiesMember_us-gaapDebtInstrumentRedemptionPeriodAxis_iiviSubsequentFiscalQuarterMember_20190924_20190924" decimals="INF">4.00</ix:nonFraction> to 1.00 for each subsequent fiscal quarter. As of December 31, 2019, the Company was in compliance with all financial covenants under the New Credit Agreement.</p>
<p style="margin-top:18pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The Company incurred $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000694" name="us-gaap:DebtRelatedCommitmentFeesAndDebtIssuanceCosts" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapCreditFacilityAxis_iiviNewSeniorCreditFacilitiesMember_20190701_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">69.8</ix:nonFraction> million of debt issuance costs in connection with the New Senior Credit Facilities. The Company evaluated these costs to determine appropriate recognition of expense under ASC 470, to account for debt modification and extinguishment. As a result of the Company&#8217;s assessment, $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000695" name="us-gaap:DeferredFinanceCostsNet" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapCreditFacilityAxis_iiviNewSeniorCreditFacilitiesMember_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">65.8</ix:nonFraction> million have been capitalized in the Condensed Consolidated Balance Sheet.&#160;&#160;Debt extinguishment costs of $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000701" name="iivi:DebtExtinguishmentCosts" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapCreditFacilityAxis_iiviNewSeniorCreditFacilitiesMember_20190701_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">4.0</ix:nonFraction> million were expensed in other expense (income), net in the Condensed Consolidated Statement of Earnings (Loss) during the six months ended December 31, 2019.&#160;&#160;The Company expensed $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000696" name="us-gaap:UnamortizedDebtIssuanceExpense" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapCreditFacilityAxis_iiviNewSeniorCreditFacilitiesMember_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6"><ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000697" name="us-gaap:UnamortizedDebtIssuanceExpense" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapCreditFacilityAxis_iiviNewSeniorCreditFacilitiesMember_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">2.9</ix:nonFraction></ix:nonFraction> million<span style="font-size:12pt;">&#160;</span>of capitalized debt issuance costs during the three and six months ended December 31, 2019 in interest expense in the Condensed Consolidated Statement of Earnings (Loss). The capitalized costs are being amortized to interest expense using the effective interest rate method from the issuance date of September 24, 2019, through the end of each facility.&#160;&#160; The unamortized discount amounted to $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000698" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentUnamortizedDiscount" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapCreditFacilityAxis_iiviNewSeniorCreditFacilitiesMember_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">62.8</ix:nonFraction> million as of December 31, 2019 and is being amortized over five and <ix:nonNumeric id="F_000700" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentConvertibleRemainingDiscountAmortizationPeriod1" contextRef="C_0000820318_srtRangeAxis_srtMaximumMember_us-gaapCreditFacilityAxis_iiviNewSeniorCreditFacilitiesMember_20190701_20191231" format="ixt-sec:durwordsen">seven years</ix:nonNumeric>, for the Term A Facility and Revolving Credit Facility, and the Term B Facility, respectively.</p>
<p style="margin-top:18pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">0.50% Finisar Convertible Notes</p>
<p style="margin-top:6pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Finisar&#8217;s outstanding <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000702" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentInterestRateStatedPercentage" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_iiviZeroPointFiveZeroPercentageConvertibleNotesDueTwoThousandThirtySixMember_20190924" decimals="INF" scale="-2">0.50</ix:nonFraction>% Convertible Senior Notes due 2036 (the &#8220;Finisar Notes&#8221;) may be redeemed at any time on or after <ix:nonNumeric id="F_000704" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentRedemptionPeriodStartDate" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_iiviZeroPointFiveZeroFinisarConvertibleNotesMember_20190924_20190924" format="ixt:datemonthdayyearen">December&#160;22, 2021</ix:nonNumeric> in whole or in part at the option of the Company at a redemption price equal to one hundred percent (<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000703" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentRedemptionPricePercentageOfPrincipalAmountRedeemed" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_iiviZeroPointFiveZeroFinisarConvertibleNotesMember_20190924_20190924" decimals="INF" scale="-2">100</ix:nonFraction>%) of the principal amount of such Finisar Notes plus accrued and unpaid interest. Each holder of Finisar Notes also may require Finisar to repurchase all or any portion of such holder&#8217;s outstanding Finisar Notes for cash on December&#160;15, 2021, December&#160;15, 2026 and December&#160;15, 2031 at a repurchase price equal to one hundred percent (100%) of the principal amount of such Finisar Notes plus accrued and unpaid interest. <ix:nonNumeric id="F_000707" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentMaturityDateDescription" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_iiviZeroPointFiveZeroFinisarConvertibleNotesMember_20190701_20191231">The Finisar Notes will mature on <ix:nonNumeric id="F_000706" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentMaturityDate" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_iiviZeroPointFiveZeroFinisarConvertibleNotesMember_20190924_20190924" format="ixt:datemonthdayyearen">December&#160;15, 2036</ix:nonNumeric></ix:nonNumeric>. <ix:nonNumeric id="F_000708" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentPaymentTerms" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_iiviZeroPointFiveZeroFinisarConvertibleNotesMember_20190701_20191231">Interest on the Finisar Notes accrues at <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000705" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentInterestRateStatedPercentage" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_iiviZeroPointFiveZeroFinisarConvertibleNotesMember_20190924" decimals="INF" scale="-2">0.50</ix:nonFraction>% per annum, paid <ix:nonNumeric id="F_000709" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentFrequencyOfPeriodicPayment" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_iiviZeroPointFiveZeroFinisarConvertibleNotesMember_20190701_20191231">semi-annually</ix:nonNumeric>, in arrears, on June&#160;15 and December&#160;15 of each year.</ix:nonNumeric></p>
<p style="margin-top:6pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">In connection with the acquisition of Finisar, the Company, Finisar and the trustee entered into a First Supplemental Indenture, dated as of September 24, 2019 (the &#8220;First Supplemental Indenture&#8221;). The First Supplemental Indenture supplements the base indenture (as supplemented, the &#8220;Finisar Indenture&#8221;), which governs the Finisar Notes. Pursuant to the terms of the First Supplemental Indenture, the Company has fully and unconditionally guaranteed, on a senior unsecured basis, the due and punctual payment and performance of all obligations of Finisar to the holders of the Finisar Notes. The First Supplemental Indenture also provides that the right of holders of </p></ix:continuation>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">18</p>
<hr style="page-break-after:always" />
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p><ix:continuation id="F_000384_dcnt_31df68d0-7086-4776-858c-fc4950412355" continuedAt="F_000384_dcnt_138bf407-9d86-4747-80e8-a41d04e74747">
<p style="margin-top:6pt;margin-bottom:0pt;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Finisar Notes to convert Finisar Notes into cash and/or shares of</span><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"> Finisar&#8217;s common stock, </span><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">is changed to a right to convert Finisar Notes into cash and/or shares of </span><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">the Company&#8217;s </span><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">common stock, subject to the terms of the Finisar Indenture</span><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">.</span></p>
<p style="margin-top:6pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Under the terms of the Finisar Indenture, the consummation and effectiveness of the Merger on the Closing Date constituted a Fundamental Change (as defined in the Finisar Indenture) and a Make-Whole Fundamental Change (as defined in the Finisar Indenture). Accordingly, in accordance with the terms of the Finisar Indenture, each holder of Finisar Notes had the right to (i)&#160;convert its Finisar Notes into cash and/or shares of Company Common Stock, at Finisar&#8217;s option, or (ii)&#160;require that Finisar repurchase such holder&#8217;s Finisar Notes for an amount in cash equal to one hundred percent (<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000710" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentRedemptionPricePercentageOfPrincipalAmountRedeemed" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_iiviZeroPointFiveZeroFinisarConvertibleNotesMember_20190924_20190924" decimals="INF" scale="-2">100</ix:nonFraction>%) of the principal amount of such Finisar Notes plus accrued and unpaid interest. </p>
<p style="margin-top:6pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Holders of approximately $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000711" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentFaceAmount" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_iiviZeroPointFiveZeroFinisarConvertibleNotesMember_20190924" decimals="INF" scale="6">560.1</ix:nonFraction>&#160;million in aggregate principal amount of Finisar Notes exercised the repurchase right. The Company repurchased those Finisar Notes on <ix:nonNumeric id="F_000713" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentRepurchaseDate" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_iiviZeroPointFiveZeroFinisarConvertibleNotesMember_20190924_20190924" format="ixt:datemonthdayyearen">October&#160;23, 2019</ix:nonNumeric> for an aggregate consideration of approximately $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000712" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentRepurchaseAmount" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_iiviZeroPointFiveZeroFinisarConvertibleNotesMember_20191023" decimals="-5" scale="6">561.1</ix:nonFraction>&#160;million in cash, including accrued interest. No holders of Finisar Notes exercised the related conversion right. The Company borrowed $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000714" name="us-gaap:ProceedsFromIssuanceOfLongTermDebt" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapCreditFacilityAxis_iiviTermALoanFacilityMember_20190924_20190924" decimals="-5" scale="6">561.0</ix:nonFraction> million under a delayed draw on its Term Loan A to fund the payment to the holders of Finisar Notes that exercised the repurchase right. As of December 31, 2019, approximately $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000715" name="us-gaap:LineOfCredit" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_iiviZeroPointFiveZeroFinisarConvertibleNotesMember_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">14.9</ix:nonFraction>&#160;million in aggregate principal amount of Finisar Notes remain outstanding. </p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p>
<p style="margin-top:8pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">0.25% Convertible Senior Notes</p>
<p style="margin-top:6pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">In August 2017, the Company issued and sold $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000716" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentFaceAmount" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_iiviZeroPointTwoFivePercentConvertibleSeniorNotesDueTwoThousandTwentyTwoMember_20170831" decimals="INF" scale="6">345</ix:nonFraction> million aggregate principal amount of the II-VI Notes in a private placement to qualified institutional buyers within the meaning of Rule 144A under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended. </p>
<p style="margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">As a result of our cash conversion option, the Company separately accounted for the value of the embedded conversion option as a debt discount. The value of the embedded conversion option was determined based on the estimated fair value of the debt without the conversion feature, which was determined using an expected present value technique (income approach) to estimate the fair value of similar nonconvertible debt&#59; the debt discount is being amortized as additional non-cash interest expense over the term of the II-VI Notes using the effective interest method.</p>
<p style="margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The equity component is not remeasured as long as it continues to meet the conditions for equity classification. The initial conversion rate is <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000717" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentConvertibleConversionRatio1" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_iiviZeroPointTwoFivePercentConvertibleSeniorNotesDueTwoThousandTwentyTwoMember_20190701_20191231" decimals="2">21.25</ix:nonFraction> shares of common stock per $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000718" name="iivi:DebtInstrumentPrincipalAmountDenominationForConversionIntoCommonStock" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_iiviZeroPointTwoFivePercentConvertibleSeniorNotesDueTwoThousandTwentyTwoMember_20191231" decimals="0" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">1,000</ix:nonFraction> principal amount of II-VI Notes, which is equivalent to an initial conversion price of $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD_xbrlishares" id="F_000719" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentConvertibleConversionPrice1" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_iiviZeroPointTwoFivePercentConvertibleSeniorNotesDueTwoThousandTwentyTwoMember_20191231" decimals="INF">47.06</ix:nonFraction> per share of common stock. Throughout the term of the II-VI Notes, the conversion rate may be adjusted upon the occurrence of certain events. The if-converted value of the II-VI Notes amounted to $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000720" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentConvertibleIfConvertedValueInExcessOfPrincipal" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_iiviZeroPointTwoFivePercentConvertibleSeniorNotesDueTwoThousandTwentyTwoMember_20190701_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">246.8</ix:nonFraction> million as of December 31, 2019 and $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000721" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentConvertibleIfConvertedValueInExcessOfPrincipal" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_iiviZeroPointTwoFivePercentConvertibleSeniorNotesDueTwoThousandTwentyTwoMember_20170701_20180630" decimals="-5" scale="6">268.0</ix:nonFraction> million as of June 30, 2019 (based on the Company&#8217;s closing stock price on the last trading day of the fiscal periods then ended). As of December 31, 2019, the II-VI Notes are not yet convertible based upon the II-VI Notes&#8217; conversion features.&#160;&#160;Holders of the II-VI Notes will not receive any cash payment representing accrued and unpaid interest upon conversion of a II-VI Note. Accrued but unpaid interest will be deemed to be paid in full upon conversion rather than cancelled, extinguished or forfeited.</p><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000405" name="iivi:InterestExpenseDisclosureTableTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000820318_20190701_20191231" escape="true">
<p style="margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The following tables set forth total interest expense recognized related to the II-VI Notes for the three and six months ended December 31, 2019 and 2018:</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p>

<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:9pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">$</p></td>
<td valign="middle" style="background-color:#DAEEF3;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;padding-Bottom:0pt;width:12.16%; border-top:solid 0.75pt #000000; border-bottom:double 2.5pt #000000;white-space:nowrap;">
<p style="text-align:right;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:9pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000733" name="us-gaap:InterestExpenseDebt" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_iiviZeroPointTwoFivePercentConvertibleSeniorNotesDueTwoThousandTwentyTwoMember_20180701_20181231" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" scale="3">6,696</ix:nonFraction></p></td>
<td valign="middle" style="background-color:#DAEEF3;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;width:1%; border-bottom:double 2.5pt transparent;white-space:nowrap;">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:1pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>
</tr>
</table></div></ix:nonNumeric>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The effective interest rate on the liability component for both periods presented was <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000736" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentInterestRateEffectivePercentage" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_iiviZeroPointTwoFivePercentConvertibleSeniorNotesDueTwoThousandTwentyTwoMember_20191231" decimals="3" scale="-2"><ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000737" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentInterestRateEffectivePercentage" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_iiviZeroPointTwoFivePercentConvertibleSeniorNotesDueTwoThousandTwentyTwoMember_20181231" decimals="3" scale="-2">4.5</ix:nonFraction></ix:nonFraction>%. The unamortized discount amounted to $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000738" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentUnamortizedDiscount" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_iiviZeroPointTwoFivePercentConvertibleSeniorNotesDueTwoThousandTwentyTwoMember_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">32.6</ix:nonFraction> million as of December 31, 2019 and $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000739" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentUnamortizedDiscount" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_iiviZeroPointTwoFivePercentConvertibleSeniorNotesDueTwoThousandTwentyTwoMember_20190630" decimals="-5" scale="6">38.3</ix:nonFraction> million as of June 30, 2019 and is being amortized over <ix:nonNumeric id="F_000740" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentConvertibleRemainingDiscountAmortizationPeriod1" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_iiviZeroPointTwoFivePercentConvertibleSeniorNotesDueTwoThousandTwentyTwoMember_20190701_20191231" format="ixt-sec:durwordsen">three years</ix:nonNumeric>. </p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;line-height:11pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></ix:continuation>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">19</p>
<hr style="page-break-after:always" />
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p><ix:continuation id="F_000384_dcnt_138bf407-9d86-4747-80e8-a41d04e74747">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;line-height:11pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Aggregate Availability</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;line-height:11pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The Company had aggregate availability of $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000741" name="us-gaap:LineOfCreditFacilityRemainingBorrowingCapacity" contextRef="C_0000820318_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">356.0</ix:nonFraction> million&#160;under its line of credit as of December 31, 2019. </p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:18pt;line-height:11pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-style:italic;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Weighted Average Interest Rate</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;line-height:11pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The weighted average interest rate of total borrowings was <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000742" name="us-gaap:DebtWeightedAverageInterestRate" contextRef="C_0000820318_20191231" decimals="3" scale="-2">3.8</ix:nonFraction>% and <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000743" name="us-gaap:DebtWeightedAverageInterestRate" contextRef="C_0000820318_20181231" decimals="3" scale="-2">1.7</ix:nonFraction>% for the six months ended December 31, 2019 and 2018, respectively. &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;  </p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;line-height:11pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">&#160;</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:9pt;">&#160;</p></ix:continuation><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000385" name="us-gaap:IncomeTaxDisclosureTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000820318_20190701_20191231" escape="true">
<div style="align:left;">
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse; width:100%;">
<tr>
<td valign="top" style="width:10.27%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><span style="font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Note</span><span style="font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;1</span><span style="font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">1</span><span style="font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">.</span></p></td>
<td valign="top">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;font-weight:bold;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;">Income Taxes </p></td></tr></table></div>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The Company&#8217;s year-to-date effective income tax rate at December 31, 2019 was an income tax benefit of <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000744" name="us-gaap:EffectiveIncomeTaxRateContinuingOperations" contextRef="C_0000820318_20190701_20191231" decimals="3" sign="-" scale="-2">10.0</ix:nonFraction>% compared to an income tax expense of <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000745" name="us-gaap:EffectiveIncomeTaxRateContinuingOperations" contextRef="C_0000820318_20180701_20181231" decimals="3" scale="-2">18.2</ix:nonFraction>% for the same period in fiscal 2018. The variations between the Company&#8217;s effective tax rate and the U.S. statutory rate of <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000746" name="us-gaap:EffectiveIncomeTaxRateReconciliationAtFederalStatutoryIncomeTaxRate" contextRef="C_0000820318_20190701_20191231" decimals="INF" scale="-2">21</ix:nonFraction>% were primarily due to the impact of the U.S. enacted tax legislation partially offset by research and development incentives in certain jurisdictions.&#160;</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">U.S. GAAP prescribes the accounting for uncertainty in income taxes recognized in an enterprise&#8217;s financial statements which includes a recognition threshold and measurement attribute for the financial statement recognition and measurement of a tax position taken or expected to be taken in a tax return. As of December 31, 2019 and June 30, 2019, the Company&#8217;s gross unrecognized income tax benefit, excluding interest and penalties, was $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000747" name="us-gaap:UnrecognizedTaxBenefitsThatWouldImpactEffectiveTaxRate" contextRef="C_0000820318_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">74.0</ix:nonFraction> million and $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000748" name="us-gaap:UnrecognizedTaxBenefitsThatWouldImpactEffectiveTaxRate" contextRef="C_0000820318_20190630" decimals="-5" scale="6">11.5</ix:nonFraction> million, respectively. In conjunction with the acquisition of Finisar, the Company assumed $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000751" name="us-gaap:LiabilityForUncertainTaxPositionsNoncurrent" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapBusinessAcquisitionAxis_iiviFinisarCorporationMember_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">64.0</ix:nonFraction> million of uncertain tax positions. The Company has classified the uncertain tax positions as noncurrent income tax liabilities, as the amounts are not expected to be paid within one year. If recognized, $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000752" name="us-gaap:LiabilityForUncertainTaxPositionsNoncurrent" contextRef="C_0000820318_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">70.3</ix:nonFraction> million of the gross unrecognized tax benefits at December 31, 2019 would impact the effective tax rate. The Company recognizes interest and penalties related to uncertain tax positions in the income tax provision in the Condensed Consolidated Statements of Earnings (Loss). The amount of accrued interest and penalties included in the gross unrecognized income tax benefit was $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000749" name="us-gaap:UnrecognizedTaxBenefitsIncomeTaxPenaltiesAndInterestAccrued" contextRef="C_0000820318_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">15.6</ix:nonFraction> million and $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000750" name="us-gaap:UnrecognizedTaxBenefitsIncomeTaxPenaltiesAndInterestAccrued" contextRef="C_0000820318_20190630" decimals="-5" scale="6">1.2</ix:nonFraction> million, at December 31, 2019 and June 30, 2019, respectively. Fiscal years <ix:nonNumeric id="F_000753" name="us-gaap:OpenTaxYear" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapIncomeTaxAuthorityNameAxis_us-gaapInternalRevenueServiceIRSMember_us-gaapTaxPeriodAxis_us-gaapEarliestTaxYearMember_20190701_20191231">2017</ix:nonNumeric> to <ix:nonNumeric id="F_000756" name="us-gaap:OpenTaxYear" examination by certain state jurisdictions, and fiscal years <ix:nonNumeric id="F_000757" name="us-gaap:OpenTaxYear" certain foreign taxing jurisdictions.&#160;&#160;The Company is currently under examination for certain subsidiary companies in Florida for the years <ix:nonNumeric id="F_000759" name="us-gaap:IncomeTaxExaminationYearUnderExamination" The Company believes its income tax reserves for these tax matters are adequate.</p></ix:nonNumeric><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000386" name="us-gaap:EarningsPerShareTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000820318_20190701_20191231" escape="true" continuedAt="F_000386_dcnt_c6723bb8-9062-49d9-b205-1a9c4c2e214b">

<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:18pt;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><span style="font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Note&#160;1</span><span style="font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">2</span><span style="font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">.</span></p></td>
<td valign="top">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:18pt;font-weight:bold;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;">Earnings Per Share </p></td></tr></table></div><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000406" name="us-gaap:ScheduleOfEarningsPerShareBasicAndDilutedTableTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000820318_20190701_20191231" escape="true" continuedAt="F_000406_dcnt_5f40b714-9afc-476e-91b4-d31983de170f">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The following table sets forth the computation of earnings per share for the periods indicated. Basic net income per share has been computed using the weighted average number of shares of Common Stock outstanding during the period. Diluted net income per share has been computed using the weighted average number of common shares outstanding during the period plus dilutive potential shares of Common Stock from (1) stock options, performance and restricted shares (under the treasury stock method) and (2) convertible debt (under the If Converted method) outstanding during the period. The Company&#8217;s convertible debt calculated under the if-converted method was anti-dilutive for the three and six months ended December 31, 2019 and 2018, and was excluded from the calculation of earnings per share (000 except per share data): </p>

<td valign="bottom" style="background-color:#FFFFFF;padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0.75pt;padding-Top:0.75pt;width:1%; border-bottom:double 2.5pt transparent;white-space:nowrap;">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:9pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>

<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:9pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>

<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:9pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>

<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:1pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>

<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p></ix:nonNumeric></ix:continuation><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000387" name="us-gaap:SegmentReportingDisclosureTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000820318_20190701_20191231" escape="true" continuedAt="F_000387_dcnt_2440cfeb-1776-4410-a371-538efbebf0e0">
<div style="align:left;">
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse; width:100%;">
<tr>
<td valign="top" style="width:10.27%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><span style="font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Note&#160;1</span><span style="font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">3</span><span style="font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">.</span></p></td>
<td valign="top">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;font-weight:bold;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;">Segment Reporting </p></td></tr></table></div>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The Company reports its business segments using the &#8220;management approach&#8221; model for segment reporting. This means that the Company determines its reportable business segments based on the way the chief operating decision maker organizes business segments within the Company for making operating decisions and assessing financial performance. </p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The Company reports its financial results in the following <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iiviSegment" id="F_000816" name="us-gaap:NumberOfReportableSegments" contextRef="C_0000820318_20190701_20191231" decimals="INF" format="ixt-sec:numwordsen">two</ix:nonFraction> segments: (i) Compound Semiconductors, and (ii) Photonic Solutions, and the Company&#8217;s chief operating decision maker receives and reviews financial information based on these segments.&#160;&#160;The Company evaluates business segment performance based upon segment operating income, which is defined as earnings before income taxes, interest and other income or expense. The segments are managed separately due to the market, production requirements and facilities unique to each segment. </p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">On September 24, 2019, the Company completed its acquisition of Finisar. See Note 3, Finisar Acquisition. Through September 30, 2019, the operating results of the Finisar acquisition are reflected in Unallocated and Other.&#160;&#160;Finisar results have been included in the Photonic Solutions and Compound Semiconductors segments during the three months ended December 31, 2019.</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The accounting policies are consistent across each segment. To the extent possible, the Company&#8217;s corporate expenses and assets are allocated to the segments. Unallocated and Other includes eliminating inter-segment sales and transfers, the results of Finisar since the acquisition date through September 30, 2019, and transaction costs related to the Finisar transaction. See Note 3 for additional information.</p></ix:nonNumeric>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">21</p>
<hr style="page-break-after:always" />

<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p><ix:continuation id="F_000387_dcnt_b2f1937c-a4f3-4b5a-879c-3bc5d1930231">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><span style="font-size:12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</span></p></ix:continuation>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:9pt;">&#160;</p><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000388" name="us-gaap:DisclosureOfCompensationRelatedCostsShareBasedPaymentsTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000820318_20190701_20191231" escape="true">
<div style="align:left;">
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse; width:100%;">
<tr>
<td valign="top" style="width:10.27%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><span style="font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Note&#160;1</span><span style="font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">4</span><span style="font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">.</span></p></td>
<td valign="top">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;font-weight:bold;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;">Share-Based Compensation </p></td></tr></table></div>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The Company&#8217;s Board of Directors adopted the II-VI Incorporated 2018 Omnibus Incentive Plan (the &#8220;Plan&#8221;), which was approved by the Company&#8217;s shareholders. The Plan provides for the grant of performance-based cash incentive awards, non-qualified stock options, stock appreciation rights, restricted share awards, restricted share units, deferred share awards, performance share awards and performance share units to employees, officers and directors of the Company. The maximum number of shares of the Company&#8217;s Common Stock authorized for issuance under the Plan is limited to <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlishares" id="F_000906" name="us-gaap:ShareBasedCompensationArrangementByShareBasedPaymentAwardNumberOfSharesAuthorized" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapPlanNameAxis_iiviOmnibusEquityIncentivePlanMember_20191231" decimals="INF" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">3,550,000</ix:nonFraction> shares of Common Stock, not including any remaining shares forfeited under the predecessor plans that may be rolled into the Plan. The Company records share-based compensation expense for these awards in accordance with U.S. GAAP, which requires the recognition of grant-date fair value of share-based compensation in net earnings (loss) and over the requisite service period of the individual grantees, which generally equals the vesting period. The Company accounts for cash-based stock appreciation rights, cash-based restricted share unit awards and cash-based performance share unit awards as liability awards, in accordance with applicable accounting standards.&#160;&#160; </p>
<p style="margin-top:6pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Upon consummation of the acquisition, the Company assumed approximately <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000907" name="iivi:BusinessAcquisitionAssumedRestrictedStockUnits" contextRef="C_0000820318_20181108" decimals="-5" scale="6">6.6</ix:nonFraction> million restricted stock units previously granted by Finisar under the Amended and Restated Finisar Corporation 2005 Stock Incentive Plan (each an &#8220;Assumed RSU&#8221;). Each Assumed RSU is subject to substantially the same terms and conditions as applied to the Assumed RSU immediately prior to the consummation of the acquisition, except that the number of shares of the Company&#8217;s common stock subject to each Assumed RSU has been adjusted in accordance with the terms of the Merger Agreement. Other than the Assumed RSUs, the Company did not assume any other awards outstanding under the Amended and Restated Finisar Corporation 2005 Stock Incentive Plan (the &#8220;Finisar 2005 Plan&#8221;). As of the Closing Date, the Company also assumed the unused capacity under the Finisar 2005 Plan.</p><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000409" name="us-gaap:ScheduleOfCompensationCostForShareBasedPaymentArrangementsAllocationOfShareBasedCompensationCostsByPlanTableTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000820318_20190701_20191231" escape="true" continuedAt="F_000409_cnt_1">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Share-based compensation expense for the periods indicated was as follows ($000): </p></ix:nonNumeric><ix:continuation id="F_000409_cnt_1">

<p style="text-align:right;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:9pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000923" name="us-gaap:AllocatedShareBasedCompensationExpense" contextRef="C_0000820318_20180701_20181231" decimals="-3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" scale="3">10,295</ix:nonFraction></p></td>

<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-size:1pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#160;</p></td>

</table></div>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:9pt;">&#160;</p></ix:continuation></ix:nonNumeric><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000389" name="us-gaap:FairValueDisclosuresTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000820318_20190701_20191231" escape="true" continuedAt="F_000389_dcnt_d9449c87-8e82-4c5a-975e-3674d6583f54">
<div style="align:left;">
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse; width:100%;">
<tr>
<td valign="top" style="width:10.27%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:9pt;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><span style="font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Note&#160;15</span><span style="font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">.</span></p></td>
<td valign="top">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:9pt;font-weight:bold;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;">Fair Value of Financial Instruments </p></td></tr></table></div>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The FASB defines fair value as the exchange price that would be received for an asset or paid to transfer a liability (an exit price) in the principal or most advantageous markets for the asset and liability in an orderly transaction between market participants at the measurement date. The Company estimates fair value of its financial instruments utilizing an established three-level hierarchy in accordance with U.S. GAAP. The hierarchy is based upon the transparency of inputs to the valuation of an asset or liability as of the measurement date as follows: </p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:12pt;">&#160;</p>
<div style="align:left;">
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse; width:100%;">
<tr>
<td valign="top" style="width:3.33%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p></td>
<td valign="top" style="width:3.33%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;font-size:10pt;font-family:'Times New Roman';font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:'Times New Roman';font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#8226;</span></p></td>
<td valign="top">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Times New Roman;">Level&#160;1&#160;&#8211;Valuation is based upon unadjusted quoted prices for identical assets or liabilities in active markets.</span></p></td></tr></table></div>
<div style="align:left;">
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse; width:100%;">
<tr>
<td valign="top" style="width:3.33%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p></td>
<td valign="top" style="width:3.33%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;font-size:10pt;font-family:'Times New Roman';font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:'Times New Roman';font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#8226;</span></p></td>
<td valign="top">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Times New Roman;">Level&#160;2&#160;&#8211;Valuation is based upon quoted prices for similar assets and liabilities in active markets, or other inputs that are observable for the asset or liability, either directly or indirectly, for substantially the full term of the financial instruments.</span></p></td></tr></table></div>
<div style="align:left;">
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse; width:100%;">
<tr>
<td valign="top" style="width:3.33%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p></td>
<td valign="top" style="width:3.33%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;font-size:10pt;font-family:'Times New Roman';font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:'Times New Roman';font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&#8226;</span></p></td>
<td valign="top">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:'Times New Roman';font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Times New Roman;">Level&#160;3&#160;&#8211;Valuation is based upon other unobservable inputs that are significant to the fair value measurements.</span></p></td></tr></table></div>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The classification of fair value measurements within the hierarchy is based upon the lowest level of input that is significant to the measurement.&#160;&#160;</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The Company entered into an interest rate swap with notional amount of $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000924" name="us-gaap:DerivativeNotionalAmount" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapDerivativeInstrumentRiskAxis_us-gaapInterestRateSwaptionMember_20191124" decimals="INF" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" scale="6">1,075</ix:nonFraction> million to limit the exposure to its variable interest rate debt by effectively converting it to a fixed interest rate. The Company receives payments based on the one-month LIBOR and makes payments based on a fixed rate of <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000925" name="us-gaap:DerivativeFixedInterestRate" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapDerivativeInstrumentRiskAxis_us-gaapInterestRateSwaptionMember_20191124" decimals="INF" scale="-2">1.52</ix:nonFraction>%. The Company receives payments with a floor of <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000926" name="us-gaap:DerivativeFloorInterestRate" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapDerivativeInstrumentRiskAxis_us-gaapInterestRateSwaptionMember_20191124" decimals="4" scale="-2">0.00</ix:nonFraction>%. The interest rate swap agreement has an effective date of <ix:nonNumeric id="F_000927" name="iivi:InterestRateSwapAgreementsEffectiveDate" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapDerivativeInstrumentRiskAxis_us-gaapInterestRateSwaptionMember_20191124_20191124" format="ixt:datemonthdayyearen">November 24, 2019</ix:nonNumeric>, with an expiration date of <ix:nonNumeric id="F_000928" name="iivi:InterestRateSwapAgreementsExpirationDate" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapDerivativeInstrumentRiskAxis_us-gaapInterestRateSwaptionMember_20191124_20191124" format="ixt:datemonthdayyearen">September 24, 2024</ix:nonNumeric>. The initial notional amount of the interest rate swap is scheduled to decrease to $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000929" name="us-gaap:DerivativeNotionalAmount" contextRef="C_0000820318_srtStatementScenarioAxis_srtScenarioForecastMember_us-gaapDerivativeInstrumentRiskAxis_us-gaapInterestRateSwaptionMember_20220731" decimals="INF" scale="6">825</ix:nonFraction> million in July 2022 and will remain at that amount through the expiration date. The Company designated this instrument as a cash flow hedge and deemed the hedge relationship effective at inception of the contract. The interest rate swap is recognized in the Consolidated Balance Sheet within other assets at fair value. Changes in fair value are recorded within other comprehensive income (loss) on the consolidated balance sheet and reclassified into the Consolidated Statement of Earnings (Loss) as interest expense in the period in which the underlying transaction affects earnings.&#160;&#160;The fair value of the interest rate swap is determined using widely accepted valuation techniques and reflects the contractual terms of the interest rate swap including the period to maturity, and while there are no quoted prices in active markets, it uses observable market-based inputs, </p></ix:nonNumeric>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">23</p>
<hr style="page-break-after:always" />
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</p><ix:continuation id="F_000389_dcnt_d9449c87-8e82-4c5a-975e-3674d6583f54">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">including interest rate curves.&#160;&#160;The fair value analysis also considers a credit valuation adjustment to reflect nonperformance risk.&#160;&#160;The interest rate swap is classified as a Level 2 item within the fair value hierarchy.</span></p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The Company estimated the fair value of the&#160;II-VI Notes and Finisar Notes based on quoted market prices as of the last trading day prior to December 31, 2019&#59; however, the II-VI Notes and Finisar Notes have only a limited trading volume and as such this fair value estimate is not necessarily the value at which the II-VI Notes and Finisar Notes could be retired or transferred. The Company concluded that this fair value measurement should be categorized within Level 2. The carrying value of the II-VI Notes and Finisar Notes is net of unamortized discount and issuance costs. See Note 10. Debt for details on the Company&#8217;s debt facilities. <ix:nonNumeric id="F_000410" name="us-gaap:ScheduleOfCarryingValuesAndEstimatedFairValuesOfDebtInstrumentsTableTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000820318_20190701_20191231" escape="true" continuedAt="F_000410_cnt_1">The fair value and carrying value of the II-VI Notes and Finisar Notes were as follows at December 31, 2019 ($000):</ix:nonNumeric> </p><ix:continuation id="F_000410_cnt_1">

<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:2pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The fair values of cash and cash equivalents are considered Level 1 among the fair value hierarchy and approximate fair value because of the short-term maturity of those instruments. The Company&#8217;s borrowings including its lease obligations, excluding the <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000934" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentInterestRateStatedPercentage" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_iiviZeroPointTwoFivePercentConvertibleSeniorNotesDueTwoThousandTwentyTwoMember_20191231" decimals="INF" scale="-2">0.25</ix:nonFraction>% Convertible Notes and the <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlipure" id="F_000935" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentInterestRateStatedPercentage" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapDebtInstrumentAxis_iiviZeroPointFiveZeroFinisarConvertibleNotesMember_20191231" decimals="INF" scale="-2">0.50</ix:nonFraction>% Finisar convertible notes are considered Level 2 among the fair value hierarchy and their principal amounts approximate fair value. </p></ix:continuation>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:9pt;">&#160;</p><ix:nonNumeric id="F_000390" name="us-gaap:TreasuryStockTextBlock" contextRef="C_0000820318_20190701_20191231" escape="true">

<td valign="top">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:18pt;font-weight:bold;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;">Share Repurchase Programs </p></td></tr></table></div>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:6pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:10pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">In August 2014, the Company&#8217;s Board of Directors authorized the Company to purchase up to $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000936" name="us-gaap:StockRepurchaseProgramAuthorizedAmount1" contextRef="C_0000820318_20140831" decimals="INF" scale="6">50</ix:nonFraction> million of its Common Stock through a share repurchase program (the &#8220;Program&#8221;) that calls for shares to be purchased in the open market or in private transactions from time to time. The Program has no expiration and may be suspended or discontinued at any time. Shares purchased by the Company are retained as treasury stock and available for general corporate purposes.&#160;&#160;During the three and six months ended December 31, 2019, the Company purchased <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlishares" id="F_000937" name="us-gaap:TreasuryStockSharesAcquired" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapShareRepurchaseProgramAxis_iiviShareRepurchaseProgramMember_20191001_20191231" decimals="INF" format="ixt:numdotdecimal"><ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlishares" id="F_000938" name="us-gaap:TreasuryStockSharesAcquired" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapShareRepurchaseProgramAxis_iiviShareRepurchaseProgramMember_20190701_20191231" decimals="INF" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">50,000</ix:nonFraction></ix:nonFraction> shares of its common stock for $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000941" name="us-gaap:TreasuryStockValueAcquiredCostMethod" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapShareRepurchaseProgramAxis_iiviShareRepurchaseProgramMember_20191001_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6"><ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000942" name="us-gaap:TreasuryStockValueAcquiredCostMethod" contextRef="C_0000820318_us-gaapShareRepurchaseProgramAxis_iiviShareRepurchaseProgramMember_20190701_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">1.6</ix:nonFraction></ix:nonFraction> million under this program. &#160;Through December 31, 2019, the Company has cumulatively purchased <ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_xbrlishares" id="F_000939" name="us-gaap:TreasuryStockSharesAcquired" contextRef="C_0000820318_20140801_20191231" decimals="INF" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">1,416,587</ix:nonFraction> shares of its Common Stock pursuant to the Program for approximately $<ix:nonFraction unitRef="U_iso4217USD" id="F_000940" name="us-gaap:TreasuryStockValueAcquiredCostMethod" contextRef="C_0000820318_20140801_20191231" decimals="-5" scale="6">22.3</ix:nonFraction> million.</p>
